snippet.textDisplay: Ach I find this video so hard to watch because the spillage in photo1 is a glass fragment shadow and exactly the same shape and position as the glass fragment in photo 2. If you rotated and change the angle this becomes obvious.  Glass can appear barely visible at an oblique angle dependent on the lighting over head. I hate AH and wish all this was true but I feel this will come out  as unimportant with higher resolution images.

snippet.textDisplay: On the "absolutely not" discussion...the Behaviour Panel (a great channel)...if I remember correctly...says that using qualifiers such as these are often linked to dishonesty. Innocent people, just say No...no need to embellish. It's not in-and-of-itself a determiner...but, taken with other factors -- like photographic evidence, propensity to lie, being a stone-cold psychopath (you know, the usual, obvious AH stuff) -- LOL -- blah blah blah...... you know where I'm going with this. I was super-happy to catch a LIVE! Woot!!  __ How does she live with herself? Not a whiff of embarrassment...not a scintilla of remorse...not a shred of decency...It is reprehensible...inhumane...incorrigible...inconceivable -- sorry, starting to have fun with the words there.

snippet.textDisplay: OH! and another thing...LOL...Les, you are talking about AH not being shaken up: I notice many of her behaviours are directly opposite to my experiences and how I reacted to my ex...goading? challenging? instigating? WHOA! I couldn't look up for fear of how he would react...and my abuse pales in comparison to her tales. It's been exactly one year since I left, and I'm feeling pretty great...but my cleaning lady tapped the sink basket on the side of the garbage can last week and I startled -- scaring her -- I had to be peeled off of the ceiling and was rendered useless for 24hrs. It's visceral, involuntary and requires time...She is so BAD at this. How is she getting away with it? I'll stop now...I'm really on a tear!

snippet.textDisplay: I could also mention Amber is a grandiose liar.  She lied in interviews and on tv saying she had donated to children's hospital (and ACLU) for years she received clout from those lies.  She donated NOTHING.  It takes a certain type of person to lie about donating money to sick and terminally ill children and their doctors and families.  And she smiled to herself on tv as she said it - because she duped the public.  She is that type of person - the type of person who would frame somebody for money and revenge.

snippet.textDisplay: @JSSTyger i think it vindicates Johnny. the footage clearly shows the entire outside hallway with no wine stains and no damage to door - plus we see that Josh tries not to let the officers in the penthouse. then we see everyone on the couch (chatting) and the dogs running around. Amber is not introducing herself or explaining what happened and no obvious bruises for identifcation. There are at least two wine bottles sitting undisturbed and delicate glass table and bar intact, the flowers are on the kitchen counter, no broken candlabras, no garbage bags with evidence of cleaning, everything sitting on the counter in perfect order. Also there are no pictures of damage in PH3 of fruit, cutlery on floor and whatnot. You can't clean like that and style items in such short time after traumatic event not to mention Amber was on the phone with her publicist and her lawyer (i think). plus the photos they took have changed metadata and don't really match their descriptions of incident. If you take Isaac's testimony he said the wine was running down the wall by penthouse 1. That's not shown in the police bodycam - and had to have been set up just before he came up the elevator and just after police had left..it's clear Amber and co. were framing johnny - the reason is that Amber wanted to get the locks changed and she needed the police to show up to get a restraining order - but she didn't need them or want them to go inside penthouse or interview her. The second set of police caught them by surprise and offguard. She wanted leverage in the divorce she didn't realize she would be going to court at that time and wasn't as careful with her "evidence" as she should have been.
snippet.textOriginal: @JSSTyger i think it vindicates Johnny. the footage clearly shows the entire outside hallway with no wine stains and no damage to door - plus we see that Josh tries not to let the officers in the penthouse.  then we see everyone on the couch (chatting) and the dogs running around.  Amber is not introducing herself or explaining what happened and no obvious bruises for identifcation.  There are at least two wine bottles sitting undisturbed and delicate glass table and bar intact, the flowers are on the kitchen counter, no broken candlabras,  no garbage bags with evidence of cleaning, everything sitting on the counter in perfect order.  Also there are no pictures of damage in PH3 of fruit, cutlery on floor and whatnot.  You can't clean like that and style items in such short time after traumatic event not to mention Amber was on the phone with her publicist and her lawyer (i think).  plus the photos they took have changed metadata and don't really match their descriptions of incident.     If you take Isaac's testimony he said the wine was *running down* the wall by penthouse 1.  That's not shown in the police bodycam - and had to have been set up just before he came up the elevator and just after police had left..it's clear Amber and co. were framing johnny - the reason is that Amber wanted to get the locks changed and she needed the police to show up to get a restraining order - but she didn't need them or want them to go inside penthouse or interview her.  The second set of police caught them by surprise and offguard. She wanted leverage in the divorce she didn't realize she would be going to court at that time and wasn't as careful with her "evidence" as she should have been.

snippet.textDisplay:
I remember my ex trashed my livingroom one time. It took me 4 hours to clean up. And it was the size of maybe....15x15 feet. It was housing by the government so not meant to be big. By the time the police had come I had cleaned it all up. But they were by 6-8 hours later not within a couple hours.
An enraged man can cause so much damage in a small amount of time but he is causing damage, the pictures I saw were not damage. It was a joke.
I also took pictures and there was not one item that was filled with damage. The only thing he couldn't break was the wooden coffee table, or couches, he just flipped those over. Still. Shit makes me mad people believe her still. What kind of never witnessed a true dv incident where he breaks all your things have they not witnessed before. Now their claims are back by "the judge in UK proved her right in 12 out of 14 incidents."
Like a judge cannot be wrong or corrupt. They seriously live in lala land.
